title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American Dream set in the Jazz Age, following the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: The story of young Scout Finch and her father Atticus, a lawyer who defends a Black man accused of raping a white woman in the racially charged South.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune tells the story of Paul Atreides as he leads nomadic tribes in a battle for control of the planet's most valuable resource, melange.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: The comedic adventures of Arthur Dent, who is whisked off Earth moments before it is destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A survey of the history of humankind from the evolution of archaic human species in the Stone Age up to the twenty-first century.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut wakes up alone on a spacecraft with no memory of who he is or his mission, discovering he must save Earth from an extinction-level threat.

title: Klara and the Sun
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: The story of Klara, an Artificial Friend with outstanding observational qualities, who watches customers come and go, hoping someone will choose her.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who shoots her husband and then stops speaking, and the criminal psychotherapist determined to get her to talk.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young girl who leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University, despite never attending school.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age story about a young woman raised in the marshes of North Carolina who becomes a suspect in the murder of a local celebrity.

title: The Overstory
author: Richard Powers
description: A novel about nine Americans whose experiences with trees bring them together to address the destruction of forests, exploring themes of environmentalism.

title: The Thursday Murder Club
author: Richard Osman
description: Four friends in a retirement village meet weekly to solve cold cases, until a local developer is found dead and they find themselves in the middle of a live case.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: A retelling of Greek mythology focused on the goddess Circe, who transforms from an awkward nymph to a formidable witch, challenging the gods themselves.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A practical guide about how tiny changes can lead to remarkable results, showing how to form good habits and break bad ones.

title: The Lincoln Highway
author: Amor Towles
description: In 1954, eighteen-year-old Emmett Watson is driven home by the warden of the juvenile work farm where he has served fifteen months for involuntary manslaughter.

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Guide for Thinking Humans
author: Melanie Mitchell
description: An accessible, comprehensive overview of modern AI, its capabilities, limitations, and the challenging questions it raises for our future.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to survive until a rescue mission can be mounted.

title: Life 3.0: Being Human in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
author: Max Tegmark
description: An exploration of AI's potential impact on the future of life on Earth and beyond, discussing both opportunities and risks.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A thriller about a woman who disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary, with her husband becoming the prime suspect.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
description: An exploration of how habits work and how they can be changed, drawing on numerous case studies from science, medicine, business, and personal improvement.
